message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the age of rocks and how footprints can be preserved. A footprint in a rock suggests that it was formed a long time ago, as it takes millions of years for rocks to form and preserve such imprints. Option (A) is incorrect because a new rock formation would not have footprints in it. Option (B) is unlikely because a random break would not create the distinct shape of a footprint. Option (C) is also unlikely because optical illusions do not typically create the detailed shape of a footprint.

This question requires some basic knowledge about geology and the formation of rocks. A footprint in a rock would indicate that it was formed by a living organism stepping on the soft sediment that eventually hardened into rock. Therefore, the footprint would suggest that it was made "very long ago." Option (A) is incorrect because a new rock formation would not have a footprint already embedded in it. Option (B) is unlikely because random breaks would not form a recognizable footprint shape. Option (C) is incorrect because an optical illusion would not produce a physical mark in the rock.

Over time, the rock hardened and preserved the imprint, giving us a glimpse into the past.
